org.mule.modules.salesforce.config

Class SalesforceBasicAuthConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mule.modules.salesforce.config.AbstractConfig
      • org.mule.modules.salesforce.config.SalesforceBasicAuthConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Config

    @ConnectionManagement(friendlyName="Basic Authentication")
public class SalesforceBasicAuthConfig
extends AbstractConfig
    Salesforce connector configuration that uses basic authentication for establishing connection with Salesforce system.
    Author:
    MuleSoft, Inc.

      • connect

        @Connect
public void connect(@ConnectionKey
                   String username,
                   @Password
                   String password,
                   @Optional
                   String securityToken,
                   @Optional@Placement(group="Connection")@FriendlyName(value="Authorization URL")@Default(value="https://login.salesforce.com/services/Soap/u/34.0")
                   String url,
                   @Optional@Placement(group="Session")
                   String sessionId,
                   @Optional@Placement(group="Session")
                   String serviceEndpoint)
             throws org.mule.api.ConnectionException
        Creates a new Salesforce session
        Parameters:
        username - Username used to initialize the session
        password - Password used to authenticate the user
        securityToken - User's security token. It can be omitted if your IP has been whitelisted on Salesforce
        url - Web service URL responsible for user authentication. This is the URL for the endpoint able to handle SOAP authentication requests.
        sessionId - This value could be used for specifying an active Salesforce session
        serviceEndpoint - Specifies the service endpoint. This value will only be used in case of using sessionId configuration property.
        Throws:
        org.mule.api.ConnectionException - if a problem occurred while trying to create the session

      • validateConfiguration

        @TestConnectivity(label="Validate configuration...")
public void validateConfiguration(@ConnectionKey
                                          String username,
                                          @Password
                                          String password,
                                          @Optional
                                          String securityToken,
                                          @Optional@Placement(group="Connection")@FriendlyName(value="Authorization URL")@Default(value="https://login.salesforce.com/services/Soap/u/34.0")
                                          String url,
                                          @Optional@Placement(group="Session")
                                          String sessionId,
                                          @Optional@Placement(group="Session")
                                          String serviceEndpoint)
                           throws org.mule.api.ConnectionException
        Validates the parameters of "Basic Authentication" global element.
        Parameters:
        username - Username used to initialize the session
        password - Password used to authenticate the user
        securityToken - User's security token. It can be omitted if your IP has been white listed on Salesforce
        url - Web service URL responsible for user authentication. This is the URL for the endpoint able to handle SOAP authentication requests.
        sessionId - This value could be used for specifying an active Salesforce session
        serviceEndpoint - Specifies the service endpoint. This value will only be used in case of using sessionId configuration property.
        Throws:
        org.mule.api.ConnectionException - if a problem occurred while trying to create the session
